meanings.definition: To raise in rank, power, or character.
meanings.sent1: The king decided to exalt his loyal servant to a higher position in the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: She always exalts her friends for their hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly threatened to exalt the class clown to the position of principal for a day.
meanings.sent4: The promotion to manager truly exalted her status within the company.
meanings.sent5: The victory in the championship game served to exalt the team's reputation in the league.

meanings.sent1: The coach would often exalt his players for their exceptional performance on the field.
meanings.sent2: The poet's verses exalt the beauty of nature in a captivating way.
meanings.sent3: The children decided to exalt their pet goldfish as the greatest swimmer in the world.
meanings.sent4: Her heartfelt speech exalted the bravery of the firefighters who saved her home.
meanings.sent5: The artist's masterpiece exalts the emotion and passion of the human experience.

meanings.definition: To elevate by praise or in estimation.
meanings.sent1: The community came together to exalt the local hero for his selfless acts of kindness.
meanings.sent2: His actions in the crisis truly exalted him in the eyes of his peers.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to exalt itself as the ruler of the household, demanding treats and attention.
meanings.sent4: Her exceptional talent exalted her above the rest of the competitors in the competition.
meanings.sent5: The heartfelt words of gratitude served to exalt the volunteers for their dedication to the cause.
